availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Ann C. Knight. Father of Elizabeth Knight Wingate, Mary H. Knight Shelby, Sarah Knight, and Emma Knight. Resident in Shelbyville, Kentucky, in 1830. Owned four enslaved persons in Shelbyville in 1830. Physician in Louisville in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Physician in Louisville in 1859. Physician in Louisville in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860.
